decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful Merfolk creatures. The deck includes various disruptive elements such as Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce to control the opponent's spells and tempo. Aether Vial helps to efficiently deploy creatures onto the battlefield, while Silvergill Adept draws extra cards. Standstill provides card advantage while also slowing down the opponent. Lord of Atlantis and Merrow Reejerey boost the power and abilities of the Merfolk tribe, while Mutavault and Wasteland provide additional disruption and damage.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponents' spells and manipulating the top of their library. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing the combination of Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top, which allows for precise counterplay. The deck utilizes a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw spells to maintain board control. Additionally, it includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to further solidify its control over the game. The inclusion of Tarmogoyf provides a strong creature threat that can close out games efficiently.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game through a combination of countering spells, destroying creatures and lands, and drawing cards with Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to stall out the game with cards like Standstill and Innocent Blood, while using Pernicious Deed to clear the board when needed. Life from the Loam and Wasteland provide land disruption, while Cunning Wish allows for flexibility in finding answers from the sideboard. This BUG Control deck focuses on disruption and control to outlast opponents and grind out a victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing the ability of Survival of the Fittest to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with creatures like Wild Mongrel, Aquamoeba, and Basking Rootwalla. By discarding creatures, it allows for the powerful recursion of Vengevine and Wonder. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Stifle and Force of Will to control the opponent's actions, while Noble Hierarch helps accelerate mana production. The inclusion of Umezawa's Jitte provides additional utility and removal options. Overall, the deck aims to use efficient creature recursion and disruption to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources through a combination of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Vindicate, and land destruction with cards like Wasteland and Knight of the Reliquary. The deck also utilizes card advantage engines such as Dark Confidant and Sensei's Divining Top to maintain a steady stream of resources. By efficiently managing the opponent's threats and resources, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and ultimately outvalue the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly bring out powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Woodfall Primus by utilizing cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. This deck aims to create explosive plays by cheating out big creatures onto the battlefield, overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats and controlling the board with counterspells and bounce spells. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's plans while quickly assembling a game-winning combo to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to use the combination of cards and spells to generate a significant amount of mana and then cast a high-cost spell like Ad Nauseam or Tendrils of Agony to overwhelm the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Burning Wish, Rite of Flame, Infernal Tutor, and Dark Ritual to generate extra mana and search for the necessary spells. The deck also includes disruption cards like Duress and Orim's Chant to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategies.

The key concept of this deck is to use the combo of Show and Tell, along with cards like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Shared Fate, to quickly and unexpectedly put powerful creatures onto the battlefield. The deck also utilizes cards like Doomsday and Sensei's Divining Top for card selection and manipulation, while controlling the game with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The goal is to set up a dominant board state and disrupt the opponent's plans, while quickly closing out the game with powerful creatures.

The key concept of this deck is to generate a high storm count in order to win the game. It utilizes cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to set up the top of the deck and dig for key combo pieces. The deck also includes cards like Cabal Ritual, Dark Ritual, and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana quickly and efficiently. The combo finish involves playing Tendrils of Agony with a high storm count, which can deal a significant amount of damage to the opponent. The deck also includes disruption and card draw spells to maintain consistency and protect the combo.

This deck revolves around flooding the board with low-cost, highly aggressive Goblin creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The key strategy is to utilize cards like Goblin Lackey and Aether Vial to put Goblins into play for free or at instant speed, while using support cards like Rishadan Port and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's resources. The deck's goal is to apply constant pressure with hasty Goblins and finish the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize or mount a defense.

The main focus of this Legacy Merfolk deck is to quickly play low-cost Merfolk creatures and utilize disruptive spells to control the game tempo. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and cards like Force of Will and Daze to counter opponent's spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Cursecatcher and Merfolk Sovereign. The inclusion of powerful Merfolk lords like Lord of Atlantis and Merrow Reejerey further strengthens the deck's ability to quickly build a large board presence and apply pressure on the opponent.

The deck consists of low-cost creatures and direct damage spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing efficient creatures like Steppe Lynx, Wild Nacatl, and Tarmogoyf, along with versatile removal spells like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Sylvan Library and Grim Lavamancer provide card advantage and additional removal options. This deck type prioritizes speed and aggression to maintain pressure on the opponent and secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this Goblin Aggro deck is to quickly swarm the board with low-cost creatures and utilize powerful Goblin synergies to overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Goblin Lackey to cheat creatures into play, along with Goblin Chieftain and Goblin Warchief to give all Goblins a boost, the deck aims to attack relentlessly and deal damage efficiently. Gempalm Incinerator provides removal options while Siege-Gang Commander offers additional damage output. The deck also incorporates disruption with cards like Warren Weirding and Rishadan Port to control the opponent's board and maintain pressure.

The main concept of this Control - Counter Top Legacy deck is to utilize cards like Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to control the opponent's spells and disrupt their game plan. The deck aims to counter or control spells using a combination of counterspells and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. Additionally, the deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to further control the game and generate card advantage. With a mix of creatures like Tarmogoyf and disruption, this deck looks to outvalue and out-control the opponent in a one-on-one match.
